channel.title: Number Theoretic Database for Twists and others
channel.description: Recent content on Number Theoretic Database for Twists and others

item.title: Jungbae Nam
item.description: I am a number theorist. I obtained my Ph.D degree in Mathematics & Statistics, Concordia University, Montréal, Québec, Canada in 2019 under the supervision of Hershy Kisilevsky and Chantal David. After that I worked as a Research Assistant professor in Mathematics & Statistics, Concordia University, Montréal, Québec, Canada until May 2020. My research areas are Arithmetic and statistics of the special L-values of modular forms; Computational algebraic/analytic number theory; Post-quantum cryptography.

item.title: Publications
item.description: Hershy Kisilevsky with Appendix by Jungbae Nam. Small Algebraic Central Values of Twists of Elliptic $L$-Functions, 2021 (Preprint) Chantal David and Lucile Devin and Jungbae Nam and Jeremy Schlitt. Lemke Oliver and Soundararajan bias for consecutive sums of two squares, Math.Ann., Nov. 2021 (DOI) (Preprint) (PARI/GP Codes) (Mathematica Codes for Th. 2.1, Prop. 7.1 and 7.2 by Jeremy Schlitt) Chantal David and Matilde Lalín and Jungbae Nam.
